intro: Wimmeria microphylla, commonly known as the small-leaf wimmeria, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and tea trees. The plant is characterized by its small, narrow leaves and produces small white or pale pink flowers. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and is found in arid or semi-arid regions. Wimmeria microphylla is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and adaptability to dry climates.
